result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Linda F. Lightfeather
Current: 2559 Oshki Oodena St, Hinckley, MN 55037 United States  (Effective: 02-28-2020)
Prior: 7764 West Main Street, c/o Faith House, Siren, WI 54872 United States
Sentencing hearing on February 19, 2020 at 11:00 am.

02:13 PM Cases 15TR103, 15TR104, 15CF99, 15CT07, 17CF96, 19CF28, 19CM57 called together.  Defendant Linda F. Lightfeather in court with attorney Ryan Anthony Reid.  Defendant in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  All cases on for plea hearing.  Signed PLQ submitted to and reviewed by Court.  Atty Reid recites agreement: G to Counts 1, 2, and 3 in 17CF96; parties free to argue for sentencing, all other counts/cases to be DRI.  Off the record, 2:17 PM.  Back on the record, 2:20 PM, same appearances.  Signed Addendum to the Plea Questionnaire submitted to and reviewed by Court.  Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas.  Def enters pleas of Guilty to Counts 1, 2, and 3 in Case 17CF96.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea.  Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds defendant guilty and orders a JOC; all other counts and cases are DRI.  Court orders PSI, long form, agent does not need to be present.  Plea/Sentencing date set for 2/19/2020 at 11:00 AM.  Atty Reid enters argument for a bond modification, asks to reduce bond to $300 additional cash.  DA argues against bond modification.  Court will not modify bond today.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2020 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on December 16, 2019 at 02:00 pm.

02:07 PM Cases 15TR103, 15TR104, 15CF99, 15CT07, 17CF96, 19CF28, 19CM57 called together.  Defendant, Linda F Lightfeather, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody.  All cases on for status conferences.  Atty Schmidt requests plea hearing, global resolution has been reached, DA Rennicke recites: def to plead to G to counts 1 and 2 in 17CF96 possession of methamphetamine and felony bail jump, all other counts/charges in Burnett County to be DRI, PSI requested, State to be capped at the high range of PSI-otherwise free to argue.  Atty Schmidt clarifies, parties state the agreement is: def to plead G in 19CF28 felony bond jump possession of THC and possession of meth in 17CF96- parties are free to argue, PSI requested.  Def pleading G to 2 felonies and a misdemeanor count, PSI requested.  Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 3, 2019 at 03:30 pm.

Must post additional $1000 to get out of jail.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  No use/possession of drugs, substances, or paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Testing of breath, blood, urine upon reasonable suspicion of use or arrest by any law enforcement officer.  AODA within 30 days and provide proof to court and follow all recommendations.  Must provide proof of incident that caused her to miss her last court appearance.

01:23 PM Cases 19CM57, 18CF28, 17CF96, 15TR104, 15TR103, and 15CF99 called together.  Defendant Linda F. Lightfeather in court, in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case on for return on warrant, failed to appear for trial in 15CF99.  Def makes statement regarding missed court appearance.  State requests $1,000 cash bond.  Court does not forfeit cash previously posted.  Court orders $1000 additional cash to be posted, same conditions as previous bond and must provide proof to court of incident that caused her to miss court at the last hearing.
Body only.

09:15 AM Cases 15TR103, 15TR104, 15CF99, 15CT07, 17CF96, 19CF28, and 19CM57 called together.  Defendant Linda F Lightfeather not in court.  Atty Ryan Reid appears.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases were on for status conferences.  Def fails to appear.  Atty Reid updates court: def contacted PD's office yesterday afternoon.  Updates defendant's number.  DA Rennicke updates court- has extended a new offer.  DA requests warrant in all files- to be stayed until noon tomorrow, body only, WI and adjacent states.  Atty Reid requests to stay until close of business today.  Court issues body only warrant; forfeits cash bond previously posted.
Status conference on October 22, 2019 at 09:00 am.
Memo requesting new date for jury trial
Jury trial - 12 person on October 22, 2019 at 08:30 am.

03:09 PM 15TR103, 15TR104, 15CF99, 15CT07, 17CF96, 19CF28, 19CM57 called together.  Defendant, Linda F. Lightfeather, appeared with Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt.  Attorney Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State.  Case was scheduled for plea/sentencing, is now on for final pre-trial, atty Schmidt updates court- no agreement has been reached.  DA believes he can get an analyst via video testimony.  All other matters to track along with 15CF99.  DA will let us know which matter (3 trials scheduled that day) we'll hear on October 22, 2019.  Bond continues.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 22, 2019 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 3, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

02:07 PM Cases 15TR103, 15TR104, 15CF99, 15CT07, 17CF96, 19CF28, and 19CM57 called together.  Defendant Linda F. Lightfeather in court with attorney Kevin Schmidt appearing telephonically.  Defendant in custody.  Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Schmidt updates court- checking into Meth Diversion program, notes he filed a motion to modify bond.  Court denies motion, citing missed court appearances.  Def atty asks for plea date.  DA updates court.  Plea hearing set for 9/6/19 at 2:00 PM.
to modify bond.
Bond in 15TR103 warrant covers all cases.

09:27 AM Cases 15TR103, 15TR104, 15CF99, 15CT07, 17CF96, 19CF28, and 19CM57 called together.  Def fails to appear.  Attorney Kevin Schmidt in court.  Joseph M. Schieffer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Schieffer requests a warrant for $1000.00 due to many failures to appears.  Warrant granted and will be issued.

02:34 PM Defendant, Linda F. Lightfeather, appeared with Attorney Kevin Schmidt.  Attorney Daniel Patrick Steffen appeared for the State.  Case on for Preliminary Hearing in 19 CF 28 and Status Conference in all others. Mr. Steffen calls Officer Horsch to testify.  Court swear Officer Horsch in.  DA asks Court to take judicial notice  of  bond in Burnett County Case No. 15 CF 99.  Court reviews bond.  Mr. Steffen questions Officer Horsch.  Officer identifies defendant.  Court finds identification is made.  Mr. Steffen continues questioning Office Horsch.  Mr. Steffen rests.  Mr. Schmidt cross-examines Officer Horsch.  Mr. Schmidt rests.  No further witnesses or argument.  Proceed to arraignment.  Acknowledge receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Court accepts NG pleas.  Mr. Schmidt will schedule off record.
Status conference on March 13, 2019 at 10:30 am.
